entry.title: DRMAAv2 C Binding - bug #104: need to clearify that returned lists are initialized with callback functions
entry.content: I don't get that. It sounds like an implementation guide ?!? The free semantics are crystal clear, so all developers must derive the according rules for their memory management.

entry.title: DRMAAv2 C Binding - bug #104: need to clearify that returned lists are initialized with callback functions
DRMAAv2 C Binding - bug #104: need to clearify that returned lists are initialized with callback functions
entry.content:
• Status changed from proposed to final review

The OGF-42 meeting decided upon the following text clarifications:

  • List and dictionary items must be deleted by the producer of them, which is either the application or the implementation itself.
  • If the application is expected to do that, then the callback can be used. This should become part of the C library documentation.

entry.title: DRMAAv2 C Binding - bug #104: need to clearify that returned lists are initialized with callback functions
entry.content:
• Status changed from final review to closed

FIxed in July 2015 errata.
